p: To assess if the susceptibility to CPC is different in oseltamivir-resistant influenza strains, we compared the virucidal activity of CPC against oseltamivir-resistant virus to that of oseltamivir-susceptible strains. Our data showed that CPC was effective against both susceptible and resistant influenza strains. Table 1 shows the EC 50 for resistant influenza A and B viruses were both 8 μg/mL, while the EC 50 for susceptible isolates ranged between 5 and 12.5 μg/mL. Notably, these EC50 values were all close to one another suggesting that CPC is equally effective against both susceptible and resistant viral strains.
